com.j2speed.async
Class AsyncLoop<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.j2speed.async.AsyncLoop<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the progressive value.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Progressive<T>
public abstract class AsyncLoop<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Progressive<T>

A loop based Progressive that executes until the execution is cancelled or the loop has no more available iterations.

Author:
Alex Nistico <alienisty(at)gmail.com>

Method Detail

run

public final void run(ProgressState<T> state)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: Progressive
Executes the request and can use the response handler to process each result as soon as it is available.

Implementation of this interface should make sure to query the State.checkCancelled() method during execution to allow a prompt and controlled execution termination.
Note, also, that when an execution is cancelled, the executing thread is interrupted, so, if the implementation uses interruptible methods, then, if clean up is necessary in those cases, the exception needs to be handled and not let it just propagate.

Specified by:
run in interface Progressive<T>
Parameters:
state - the ProgressState that the implementing class can use to notify the ProgressHandler for this async.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when an exception happened within the execution an need to be sent to the exception handlers.

hasNext

protected abstract boolean hasNext()
Whether the loop condition is met or not.

Returns:
true if the loop condition is still met, false otherwise.

next

@CheckForNull
protected abstract T next()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Invoked until the execution is not cancelled or the loop condition is true

Returns:
the result of the current iteration or null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when an exception happened within the execution and need to be sent to the exception handlers.
